clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation of Serum CA19-9 Levels With Levels in Saliva and Urine of Patients With Ductal Adenocarcinoma of the Pancreas
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation of Serum CA19-9 Levels With Levels in Saliva and Urine of Patients With Ductal Adenocarcinoma of the Pancreas

brief_summary.textblock:
Ductal adenocarcinoma of the pancreas is the fifth leading cause of cancer related deaths in the European Union. Tumor markers CA19-9 and carcinoembryonic antigen are important components in decision making and follow-up of patients diagnosed with this disease.
These tumor markers were found to be elevated not only in the serum but also in other body fluids in patients with malignant lesions of the parotid gland and the urinary tract. The authors have described in a previews small preliminary study a positive and a strong linear correlation between the levels of CA19-9 in urine and saliva with those presented in the serum of patients with ductal adenocarcinoma of the pancreas. The current study seeks to enlarge the study population to confirm the previous results and standardize the measured levels of CA19-9 in these body fluids.

primary_outcome.measure: correlation of CA19-9 levels in urine and saliva with those in the serum

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants needed to standardize the measurements in urine and saliva according to those measured in the serum.
secondary_outcome.description: upper and lower levels of CA19-9 measured in urine and saliva are not yet standardized. and repeated measurements in these body fluids compared to the ones in serum of healthy subjects are needed for such standardization.

arm_group.description: Patients with a proven diagnosis of ductal adenocarcinoma of the pancreas with elevated levels of CA19-9 and possibly elevated CEA levels. intervention: samples of blood, saliva and urine
Patients or healthy volunteers with out a known evidence of malignancy with presumably normal levels of CA19-9 and CEA. intervention: samples of blood, saliva and urine

intervention.intervention_name: samples of blood, saliva and urine
intervention.description: Spot samples of Blood, urine and saliva

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients:
- Proven diagnosis of ductal adenocarcinoma of the pancreas
- elevated levels of CA19-9
- possible elevated levels of CEA
Exclusion Criteria:
Controls:
- Previous diagnosis of malignancy
